Description: Two joining sherds of rim of East Greek pottery krater(?); inner surface of 'neck' rough and reserved; added moulded female head on outside of rim; pre-firing hole in top of her head, preseumably to aid firing and four others pierced through rear of rim, possibly for an attachment. Band of maeander, with one central dotted square, on top of rim; maeander on outside; underside of rim and top of neck reserved, neck below slipped and glazed.
Curator's comments: A very curious piece, with two roughly finished surfaces (interior and top of neck) and drill holes suggesting that there was some form of substantial attachment.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.716)
